title: Towards smart statistics in labour market domain

author: Inna Novalija, Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: So the second presentation is called towards small statistics in labor market domain.
First of all, a little bit of introduction with smart statistic is and what you would like to get from smart statistics.

Traditionally, statisticians, labor market statisticians used a number of traditional methods such as surveys, job vacancy service, which, so wage surveys labor for service in order to get statistical indicators and statistical outputs.
Now with the recent development of sensor data and Yuji Technologies and Substitions realize that they would like to get more into analysis of such different data datasets.
Now what we would like to make with smart statistics in labor market domain is to make statistics.
Data driven.
Statistics would not come from service but would come from data.
It would be a bottom up view on statistics, let's say.
So the data driven smart label market statistics intent intends to use the available historical job vacancies data available, real time job vacancies, data and.
Additional datasets which are available and we also would like to align these different data sources to common datasets and construct models.
Obtain novel indicators which would complement the existing statistical indicators.
This so question is dusk addresses.
A number of policy questions such as job creation, education, training systems, labor market segmentation, improving skills and productivity.
And there are number of stakeholders who would be interested in this kind of results.
First of all, those are statisticians from national statistical offices and every start.

Then we have individual people who would be interested in job demand statistics and we have public and private employment agencies and educational and training institutions who would be interested in the new skills appearing on the labor market.
Because ministers of Labor finances economy who would be in policymakers who would influence the labor market.
We also have standard development organizations who actually deal with developing ontologies for different skills and other issues related to this so.
The main data sources for our problem are a collection of job vacancies from 2015 to 2018 around Europe.
Currently we have more than 5 million job vacancies which will process and analyze and extract skills from this job vacancies.
Additional data sources for these problems can be social media data, labor supply, supply data based on user profile analysis.
Some other data.

Along with location and date.

Clustered in different locations.

As you can see, there are a couple of data sources such as web script, your vacancies and we have some labor supply data sources and additional data sources.
We have defined three scenarios.
First, as demand analysis scenario.
Second, this ontology development scenario and serve this ontology, evolution scenario and target user assigned.

Those policymakers, educational training institutions, academia, research statisticians, and some others, but important is our applications are going to be multi functional so we are going to provide statistics on cross country level on country level, city level and conceptual level.
So we have we going to have different levels of statistics which would be useful for different different stakeholders.
And.
A couple of words about the scenarios, so in demand analysis scenario we would like to produce statistical indicators based on available job vacancies.
You would like to see which skills are available in which countries and to which extent.
So the problems which address here are crossing, volunteer then location disambiguation skill.
This integration and aggregation in ontology development.
We would like to build an ontology out of the extracted skills.
I currently statisticians use.
ESCO ontology for their purposes.
But the ontologist which they use are not updated so frequently as they would, they should be.
So our goal with this task is to suggest an automatic or semi automatic ontology evolution process based on real time job vacancy system.
So the ontologists used updated frequently and when needed when requested.

The statistical indicators which we would like to get out of the task.
Are related to job vacancy statistics on across country CD level area.
For example, job vacancies in UK and France in the last month.
How old are dope skills in the UK in the last month?
Top location for a specific skill offer.
For example, we can have indicators at conceptual level, number of concepts in the ontology and emerging Skills ontology in the last three months.

And so this work is starting now and this is a proposal for development, smart statistics, smart labor market statistics based on streams of enriched textual data such as job vacancies from European countries.

And currently we have defined smart statistics scenarios and we have also started to work on the scenarios and our future task would be to develop this scenario sent to build applications which would be used in valuated by statisticians.

Another important issue which we should address in this work is quality assessment because whatever every task which is related to statistical process should be correctly assessed with respect to quality issues.
So evaluation is very important for our tasks.
